physical_exercises.exercise_for_feet_exercise_in_bed: The person lies comfortably on their back in bed, legs relaxed hip-width apart, arms resting against the body, head supported by a pillow. Ask the person to pull the toes towards the chin and then push down (outwards). The person performs the exercise to the best of their ability, with assistance if needed.
physical_exercises.bending_a_leg_exercise_in_bed: The person lies comfortably on their back in bed, legs relaxed hip-width apart, arms resting against the body, head supported by a pillow. Ask the person to drag the heel on the surface towards the buttocks in a contracted position and then extend the leg back on the surface to the lying position. Alternate the exercise with the right leg first and then the left leg. The person performs the exercise to the best of their ability and is assisted if necessary.
physical_exercises.lifting_the_heels_exercise_in_bed: The person lies comfortably on their back in bed, legs relaxed at hip-width, arms by their side, and head resting on a pillow; a pillow or cushion is placed under their knees. Ask the person to lift their heels off the surface, hold the position for a few seconds, and slowly lower them back to the surface. The person performs the exercise to the best of their ability, with assistance if needed.
physical_exercises.lifting_of_the_hips_exercise_in_bed: The person is lying comfortably on their back in bed, arms by their body, and head resting on a pillow. The person is asked to fold their legs at right angles, lift their buttocks off the surface, hold the position for a few seconds, and lower the buttocks back to the surface. The person performs the exercise to the best of their ability and is assisted if necessary.
physical_exercises.knee_exercise_with_a_ball_exercise_in_be: The person lies comfortably on their back in bed, arms by their body, head resting on the pillow, and legs bent at right angles. Place a ball between the person's knees and ask them to squeeze the ball between their knees with all their strength, hold it for a few seconds, and then release it. The person performs the exercise to the best of their ability and is assisted if necessary.
physical_exercises.opening_a_book_knee_exercise_exercise_in: The person is lying comfortably on their back in bed, arms by their body, head resting on a pillow, legs bent at right angles. Ask the person to open their legs outwards and then back together. The person performs the exercise to the best of their ability and is assisted if necessary.
physical_exercises.touching_knee_with_an_opposite_hand_exer: The person is lying comfortably on their back in bed, arms by their body, head resting on the pillow, legs bent at right angles. Ask the person to try to touch their right knee with their left hand and repeat the exercise with the other hand. The person does the exercise to the best of their ability and is assisted if necessary.
physical_exercises.lifting_arms_above_your_head_exercise_in: The person lies comfortably on their back in bed, head resting on a pillow, legs bent at right angles; ask them to fold their arms in front of them, slowly raise them above their head, and slowly lower them back in front of them. The person does the exercise to the best of their ability, with assistance if needed.
physical_exercises.hip_flexibility_exercise_exercise_in_bed: The person is lying comfortably on their back in bed, with their legs relaxed hip-width apart, arms by their body, and head resting on a pillow. Ask the person to bend the right leg, extend the left leg as far as possible, hold the position for a few seconds, and then relax and extend the right leg backwards. Repeat the exercise with the other leg. The person performs the exercise to the best of their ability and is assisted if necessary.
physical_exercises.standing_on_toes_fall_prevention: Stand relaxed and upright in front of the back of the chair (chest out, belly in), feet parallel and hip-width apart, with the back of the chair in front of you so that you (can) hold onto it with both hands. Slowly rise on toes, hold and lower to the entire foot. In a slow four-beat rhythm: 1 - rise, 2 - hold, 3 - descend, 4 - rest. Doing all the exercises fluidly and connectedly is essential, like a dance. Note that the exercise's fourth beat is meant to relax the whole body before starting again.
physical_exercises.lifting_leg_forwards_fall_prevention:
Stand relaxed and upright (chest out, belly in) with feet parallel and hip-width apart; stand sideways to the chair so that you (can) hold the back of the chair with your right hand. The body's weight is on the leg, not next to the chair, so we practise with the leg next to the chair to be stable and safe from losing balance. First, stretch the right leg forward and then step in a four-beat rhythm: 1 - lift the leg forward, 2 - keep it in the air, 3 - lower it to the floor to the starting position, 4 - rest by swaying slightly, relaxed and bending at the knees. 
After repetitions, turn half a circle so you can hold onto the back of the chair with your left hand and repeat the exercise with your left leg.
physical_exercises.lifting_leg_backwards_fall_prevention: Stand relaxed and upright (chest out, belly in) with feet parallel and hip-width apart; stand sideways to the chair so that you (can) hold the back of the chair with your right hand. The body's weight is on the leg, not next to the chair, so we practise with the leg next to the chair to be stable and safe from losing balance. Lift the leg next to the chair off the floor back to a height where you still feel stable while at the same time leaning the torso slightly forward, and then step in a four-beat rhythm: 1 - lift the leg backwards, 2 - keep it in the air, 3 - lower it to the floor to the starting position, 4 - rest by swaying slightly, relaxed and bending at the knees.  After repetitions, turn half a circle so you can hold onto the back of the chair with your left hand and repeat the exercise with your left leg.
physical_exercises.lifting_leg_to_the_side_fall_prevention:
Stand relaxed and upright in front of the back of the chair (chest out, belly in), feet parallel and hip-width apart, with the back of the chair in front of you so that you (can) hold onto it with both hands. First, lift the extended right leg to the side to a height where it still feels stable. Perform the exercise in a four-beat rhythm: 1 - lift the leg sideways, 2 - keep it in the air, 3 - lower it to the floor to the starting position, 4 - rest by rocking slightly, relaxing, and bending at the knees.
After the repetitions, repeat the exercise with the left leg.
physical_exercises.bending_knee_lifting_leg_and_touching_it: Stand relaxed and upright (chest out, belly in) with feet parallel and hip-width apart; stand sideways to the chair so that you (can) hold the back of the chair with your right hand. Lift the knee of the leg against the back of the chair to a height where you still feel stable. In doing so, squeeze the hip and abdominal muscles of the leg you are standing on. To increase the difficulty and effectiveness of the exercise, place the opposite hand on the knee of the bent and raised leg. The exercise is performed in a four-beat rhythm: 1 - bend and lift the leg (touching it with the opposite hand), 2 - hold the position, 3 - lower it to the ground to the starting position, 4 - rest by rocking slightly, relaxed and bending at the knees. After repetitions, turn half a circle so you can hold onto the back of the chair with your left hand and repeat the exercise with your left leg.
physical_exercises.leaning_the_body_forward_fall_prevention: We position ourselves in front of the back of the chair so that it is a safety support in front of us in case we lean too far forward and lose our balance. Extend your arms perpendicular to your body, palms facing upwards at the wrists. Then, slowly lean forward with the whole body, keeping the body straight all the time, with no bending at the hips, abdomen, chest, or neck, only at the ankles. Keep leaning as long as you can balance using the muscles on the back of your legs and your abdominal muscles. Always keep the whole foot (including the heel!) on the floor. Lean forward in a four-beat rhythm: 1 - lean forward, 2  hold the position, 3 - return to a neutral position, 4 - rest.

breathe_exercises.breathing_with_the_prefix_exercise_in_be:
The person lies comfortably on their back in bed, legs relaxed hip-width apart, head resting on a pillow. It is best to do the exercise together with the person. 
Place the palms of the hands on the lower third of the chest (ribs). 
Slowly inhale through the nose, feeling the chest expand under your hands. 
Hold your breath for a moment. 
Exhale slowly with the lips closed, feeling the chest under our hands return to its original position.
breathe_exercises.lifting_the_elbow_away_from_the_body_exe:
The person lies comfortably on their back in bed, legs relaxed hip-width apart, head resting on a pillow. It is best to do the exercise together with the person. 
Bend the arms at the elbows at right angles to the body. 
Slowly inhale through the nose and open the arms to shoulder height.
Hold your breath for a moment.
Slowly exhale, lowering the arms to their original position.
breathe_exercises.blowing_newspaper_strips_on_the_trapeze_:
For this exercise, we need a trapeze. The person is lying comfortably on their back in bed, if they can, with their head slightly raised and a pillow under their knees, with their arms resting next to their body - this will make the person more comfortable and easier to perform the exercise. Glue newspaper strips to the trapeze. 
Slowly inhale through the nose and hold the breath.
On the exhalation, encourage the person to blow the newspaper strips as high as possible.
breathe_exercises.blowing_the_whistle_exercise_in_bed:
For this exercise, we need a whistle. The person is lying comfortably on their back in bed, if they can, with their head slightly raised and a pillow under their knees, arms resting next to their body - this will make the exercise more comfortable and easier for the person to do. If the person is strong enough, they can also do the exercise sitting down, leaning on a table.
The person slowly inhales through the nose and holds the breath.
On exhalation, they blow the air through the whistle.
breathe_exercises.blowing_ping_pong_balls_exercise_in_bed:
For this exercise, we need a table and ping-pong balls. If the person is lying in bed, lift the pillow and place the table before them, then put the ping-pong balls on the table. If the person is strong enough, they can also do the exercise sitting up, leaning on the table.
The person slowly inhales through the nose and holds the breath.
They blow the ping pong balls off the table on exhalation.
breathe_exercises.blowing_soap_bubbles_exercise_in_bed:
For this exercise, we need a soap bubble tool. The exercise is fun and suitable, especially for people who are harder to motivate to do breathing exercises. The person can do the exercise lying in bed or sitting up, leaning on the bed.
The person slowly inhales through the nose and holds the breath.
They blow through the soap bubble ring on exhalation.
breathe_exercises.chest_expansion_breathing_exercise_sitti: Sit or stand upright. Place your hands on the lower third of your chest (ribs).Slowly inhale through your nose, feeling your chest expand under your hands.Hold your breath for a moment. Slowly exhale with the lips closed and feel the fingertips under your hands return to their original position.
breathe_exercises.chest_opening_breaths_exercise_sitting: Sit or stand upright. Place your hands on the back of your neck. Slowly inhale through your nose, opening your elbows (as if opening a book).Hold your breath for a moment.Then slowly exhale with the lips closed.Push your elbows together (closing the book) while bending your head and upper torso.
breathe_exercises.abdominal_breathing_exercise_sitting:
Lying down or sitting upright. Relax the shoulders and upper chest.
Place one hand on the abdomen (at the navel level) and the other on the upper part of the chest. Slowly inhale through the nose. The abdomen should bulge outwards. Also, the hand resting on the abdomen should rise more than the hand resting on the upper chest. Slowly exhale through the mouth while lowering the abdomen.

challenge1.title: A teacher I remember with happiness and pride
challenge1.description: Albert Einstein valued teachers, calling teaching an art that awakens joy, creativity, and knowledge. Share a story about a teacher who inspired you, and ask your challenge partner to do the same.

challenge2.title: Let's walk together
challenge2.description: Invite a challenge partner or someone you haven't seen in a while for a walk. Observe your surroundings and share at least one good thing that's happened to each of you recently. If walking is difficult, do a favorite exercise together.

challenge3.title: What am I proud of and thankful for
challenge3.description: Autumn, like our lives, is full of abundance and color. Reflect on your journey: note a great achievement, a difficulty overcome, and a happy moment. Challenge: Ask your challenge partner about their greatest achievement or a happy moment. Listen attentively, thank them, and share one of your own experiences. Sharing helps us understand each other better.

challenge4.title: Share a little smile with me
challenge4.description: Good humor and kind smiles can lift spirits. Enter a friendly competition with your challenge partner or someone you choose to see who can smile and greet the most people in one day.

challenge5.title: Our roots
challenge5.description: Knowing our roots grounds us. Share family stories with your challenge partner, whether from your immediate family or ancestors. If you change partners, invite a relative and share these stories. Create a good atmosphere and express your desire to pass on this valuable family history.

challenge6.title: Some things were different
challenge6.description: In recent decades, the world has changed rapidly in travel, chores, and technology. Do you remember how things were different when you were young? Share a story with your challenge partner and ask about their memories toothey might recall something similar or different.

challenge7.title: A love story
challenge7.description: Love has shaped who we areromantic, parental, or between friends. What's the first love story that comes to mind from your life? Share it with your challenge partner and ask about their love story too.

challenge8.title: Let's share a small precious memory
challenge8.description: Share a couple of precious memories from your phone with your challenge partner and ask them to do the same. If photos aren't available, use a photo album. Share the stories behind one or two photos each, focusing on moments from recent weeks or months.

challenge9.title: This photo/picture reminds me of
challenge9.description: Over the next few days or a week, pay attention to photos and pictures around you with your challenge partner. Choose one you like and share it when you meet next. Explain why you like it and if it reminds you of anything.

challenge10.title: My home
challenge10.description: One of Slovenian thinkers said that loving our homeland gives us freedom that is rooted. Despite criticisms, loving our homeland gives us rooted freedom. Let's take one meeting to share what we love about our country. Despite its challenges, there's much to appreciate.

challenge11.title: My favorite book
challenge11.description: Thinking about all the books you've read in your life, is there a book that comes to mind, maybe book you especially like? Present that book to your challenge partner and ask about her/his favorite book.

challenge12.title: Music connects us
challenge12.description: Share a favorite song or one you're currently enjoying with your challenge partner or chosen person, along with a music-related personal story. Ask them for their song preference. If possible, listen to one song suggested by each of you. Did your music taste change over the years?

challenge13.title: A letter to my future self
challenge13.description: Write a short letter to your future self (it can be in a few months, a year ot 2-3 years) about what you hope to achieve, how you want to grow, or what advice you would give yourself. Share this with your challenge partner and ask them to do the same. Discuss your thoughts and dreams together.

challenge14.title: A small act of kindness
challenge14.description: Do a small act of kindness for a stranger, friend, or family memberthis could be as simple as holding the door open, giving a compliment, or helping someone in need. Encourage your challange partner to do the same and share the experience afterwards.

challenge15.title: A meal from the past
challenge15.description: Food has a powerful connection to our memories and culture. Cook or share a meal that reminds you of your childhood, a special person, or an important event in your life. Invite your challenge partner to do the same, and have a conversation about why these meals are meaningful to each of you. If cooking together is too difficult, simply talk about the special meal and consider sharing the recipe instead.

challenge16.title: Things we like to do
challenge16.description: As a youngster, you probably liked to do different things in your free time - maybe you liked reading, maybe doing sports, dancing, or maybe you collected something. Think over the period of the last 5-10 years. What is one thing you enjoy doing now in your free time? Did it change from your young years? Share your experience with your challenge partner and ask her/him to do the same.

challenge17.title: If I could relive any day in my life
challenge17.description: Is there a day in your life youd love to experience againnot to change anything, but just to enjoy it again? Maybe a trip, a celebration, or a simple, perfect day. Ask your partner to share theirs.

challenge18.title: A lesson from a hard time
challenge18.description: Instead of focusing on difficulties, share a moment when you went through a challenge but learned something valuable from it. Ask your conversation partner to do the same.

challenge19.title: The kind thing someone has done for me
challenge19.description: Reflect on a time when someone showed you kindness. It could be a small gesture or a life-changing act. Share your experience with your challenge partner, then ask your conversation partner to share their story.

challenge20.title: The most beautiful place Ive ever seen
challenge20.description: Describe a place youve visited that took your breath away. Maybe it was nature, a city, or even a simple but special moment. Ask your partner to share something she/he found beautiful and/or special.

challenge21.title: I received a very good advice
challenge21.description: Whats one piece of advice that really stuck with you and helped you in life? Who gave it to you? What was the situation? Share it and see if your conversation partner has a great piece of wisdom to pass along.

challenge22.title: A conversation starter jar
challenge22.description: The list of challanges is coming to an end. But maybe you still have some ideas, things you would like to discuss with your challange partner. Maybe you can both prepare a jar with small papers containing different conversation starters (e.g., "What is one thing youve always wanted to try?" or "How did you experience your retirement? / first love? ..."). In the next meetings - maybe before you meet for a cofee or a walk - you can draw a paper from the jar and use it for a dissusion topic.

validation.PHONE_NUMBER: Incorrect phone number. The correct format is: +[country code]-[number]
validation.PAGE_SIZE_MIN: pageSize needs to be at least {constraints.0}
validation.MIN: Value needs to be at least {constraints.0}
validation.MAX: Value needs to be less than or equal to {constraints.0}
validation.ENUM: {property} must be one of the following values: {constraints.1}
validation.AUTH_PASSWORD: Password must contain at least 8 characters, including one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one digit and at least one special character.
validation.WAKE_UP_TIME_FORMAT: {property} must be a valid time format (HH:mm)
validation.TIME_OF_DAY: {property} can only be provided if name is one of the values: {acceptedValues}
validation.FEEDBACK_RATING: {property} can only be provided if rating is one of the values: {acceptedValues}
validation.EXCLUDED_VALUES: Each value in {property} must be one of the following values: {allowedValues}

performance_decline.subject: Performance Decline
performance_decline.body:
We have noticed a decline in the performance metrics related to the care of the senior {name} under your supervision. Please review the following details to understand the situation and take necessary actions to ensure their well-being.

For more detailed insights please visit senior {name} profile.

user_inactive_for_7_plus_days.subject: User Inactive for 7+ Days
user_inactive_for_7_plus_days.body: We see that {name} has not been active for over 7 days. Please check on them to ensure their well-being.

monitoring_visit_request.subject: Monitoring Visit Request
monitoring_visit_request.body: A monitoring visit is needed for {name}. Please schedule and complete the visit soon.

new_senior_assigned.subject: New Senior Assigned
new_senior_assigned.body: A new senior has been assigned to you.

new_informal_caregiver_assigned_to_senio.subject: New Informal Caregiver Assigned
new_informal_caregiver_assigned_to_senio.body: A new informal caregiver has been assigned to a senior.

new_formal_caregiver_assigned_to_senior.subject: New Formal Caregiver Assigned to Senior
new_formal_caregiver_assigned_to_senior.body: A new formal caregiver has been assigned to {name}. Please review the details and ensure a smooth and seamless transition for their continued care.

user_completed_their_daily_assignment.subject: User Completed Their Daily Assignment
user_completed_their_daily_assignment.body: We are pleased to inform you that {name} has successfully completed their daily assignment. Keep up the good work and continue to support their progress.

new_note_added.subject: New Note Added
new_note_added.body: A new note has been added to the profile of {name}. Please review this note for important updates and take any necessary actions.

new_document_uploaded.subject: New Document Uploaded
new_document_uploaded.body: A new document has been uploaded for {name}. Please review this document to stay informed and ensure proper care.

new_care_plan_assigned.subject: New Care Plan Assigned
new_care_plan_assigned.body: A new care plan has been assigned to {name} .To review care plan and get started, please click the link below.

first_entry_email.welcome: Welcome to Procareful! To activate your account and get started, please click the link below

landing_page_email.thank_you: Thank you for your interest in our app! You can download the app using the following link

password_change_email.change_pass_info: You recently requested to change your password for your Procareful account. Please confirm this change by entering the verification code below on our website.
password_change_email.contact_institution: If you did not request this change, please contact your Instituion immediately.

pin_code_email.complete_verification_process: To complete the verification process, please enter the verification code below. This code will help us ensure the security of your account and verify your identity.

notificationEmails.footer: If you believe this is a mistake, please ignore this email
notificationEmails.expire_link: This link will expire in {time} hours.
notificationEmails.expire_code: This verification code will expire in {time} hours.

keys.k_can_walk_without_support: Can you walk more than a few steps without support?
keys.k_severe_balance_problems: Do you have severe problems with your balance?
keys.k_vigorous_activity_days_last_week: During the last 7 days, on how many days did you do vigorous physical activities like heavy lifting, digging, aerobics, or fast bicycling?
keys.k_vigorous_activity_minutes_per_day: How much time did you usually spend doing vigorous physical activities on one of those days?
keys.k_moderate_activity_days_last_week: During the last 7 days, on how many days did you do moderate physical activities like carrying light loads, bicycling at a regular pace, or doubles tennis? Do not include walking.
keys.k_moderate_activity_minutes_per_day: How much time did you usually spend doing moderate physical activities on one of those days?
keys.k_walking_days_last_week: During the last 7 days, on how many days did you walk for at least 10 minutes at a time?
keys.k_walking_minutes_per_day: How much time did you usually spend walking on one of those days?
keys.k_time_sitting_last_week: During the last 7 days, how much time did you spend sitting on a week day?
keys.k_experience_of_emptiness: I experience a general sense of emptiness [EL]
keys.k_miss_having_people_around: I miss having people around me [EL]
keys.k_rely_on_people: There are plenty of people I can rely on when I have problems [SL]
keys.k_trust_completely: There are many people I can trust completely [SL]
keys.k_enough_people_feel_close: There are enough people I feel close to [SL]
keys.k_general_health_desc: Senior's assessment of their current health on a scale from 0 to 100.
keys.k_bed_time: During the past month, what time have you usually gone to bed at night?
keys.k_fall_asleep_duration: During past month, how long (in minutes) has it usually taken you to fall asleep each night?
keys.k_wake_up_time: During the past month, what time have you usually gotten up in the morning?
keys.k_actual_sleep_hours: During past month, how many hours of actual sleep did you get at night?
keys.k_trouble_sleeping: During the past month, how often have you had trouble sleeping because you...
keys.k_cannot_sleep_within_30_minutes: Cannot get to sleep within 30 minutes
keys.k_wake_up_midnight_or_early_morning: Wake up in the middle of the night or early morning
keys.k_need_to_use_bathroom: Have to get up to use the bathroom
keys.k_medicine_for_sleep: During the past month, how often have you taken medicine to help you sleep (prescribed or "over the counter")?
keys.k_trouble_staying_awake_frequency: During the past month, how often have you had trouble staying awake while driving, eating meals, or engaging in social activity?
keys.k_enthusiasm_to_get_things_done: During the past month, how much of a problem has it been for you to keep up enough enthusiasm to get things done?
keys.k_sleep_quality_rating: During the past month, how would you rate your sleep quality overall?
keys.k_have_bed_partner_or_room_mate: Do you have a bed partner or room mate?
keys.k_room_mate_or_bed_partner: If you have a room mate or bed partner, ask him/her how often in the past month you have had...
keys.k_breathing_pause: Long pauses between breaths while asleep
keys.k_legs_twitching: Legs twitching or jerking while you sleep
keys.k_sleep_disorientation: Episodes of disorientation or confusion during sleep
keys.k_other_restlessness: Other restlessness while you sleep; please describe

frequency.three_or_more_times: Three or more times a week

mobility.none: I have no problems in walking about
mobility.slight: I have slight problems in walking about
mobility.moderate: I have moderate problems in walking about
mobility.severe: I have severe problems in walking about
mobility.extreme: I am unable to walk about

self_care.none: I have no problems washing or dressing myself
self_care.slight: I have slight problems washing or dressing myself
self_care.moderate: I have moderate problems washing or dressing myself
self_care.severe: I have severe problems washing or dressing myself
self_care.extreme: I am unable to wash or dress myself

usual_activities.none: I have no problems doing my usual activities
usual_activities.slight: I have slight problems doing my usual activities
usual_activities.moderate: I have moderate problems doing my usual activities
usual_activities.severe: I have severe problems doing my usual activities
usual_activities.extreme: I am unable to do my usual activities

pain_discomfort.none: I have no pain or discomfort
pain_discomfort.slight: I have slight pain or discomfort
pain_discomfort.moderate: I have moderate pain or discomfort
pain_discomfort.severe: I have severe pain or discomfort
pain_discomfort.extreme: I have extreme pain or discomfort

anxiety_depression.none: I am not anxious or depressed
anxiety_depression.slight: I am slightly anxious or depressed
anxiety_depression.moderate: I am moderately anxious or depressed
anxiety_depression.severe: I am severely anxious or depressed
anxiety_depression.extreme: I am extremely anxious or depressed

bed_partner_or_room_mate.no_partner_or_roommate: No bed partner or room mate
bed_partner_or_room_mate.partner_same_room_not_bed: Partner in same room, but not same bed
